fields.headline: Harrison looks to rebuild reputation against Skelton
fields.bodyText: Audley Harrison, the 2000 Olympic super-heavyweight champion, is to challenge Bedford's Matt Skelton for the Commonwealth heavyweight title at London's ExCel Centre on December 9, the promoter Frank Warren confirmed yesterday. "Audley lost to Danny Williams last year, and let himself down," said Warren. "He must know that if he looks as bad again, it is difficult to see where he can go in the sport." The contest is the principal support on a promotion headlined by Scott Harrison's WBO featherweight world title defence against Dagenham's Nicky Cook. Amir Khan is due to fight on the same bill, but so far his opponent has not been named.
